characters: SHOTS OF CATACLYSM. CUT FASTER AND FASTER UNTIL...
GRUG AND THE CROODS. GUY'S ARMS ARE FILLED WITH
ON THE BASE OF THE POPCORN PILE
WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL THEY ARE SURROUNDED BY PUNCH
GUY STANDS AT THE EDGE OF THE CORAL, ONLY A FEW FEET FROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cave painting of the Dreamworks logo. Push past the moon to the sun. Bright. Beautiful. The sun DISSOLVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cave paintings of a family of cavemen -- we will come to know them as The Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every sun comes a new day. A new beginning. A hope that things will be better today than they were yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods scurry out of their cave like mice looking for food. Scared. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods are chased by beasts across the desert. They escape from creatures up trees. They hide behind rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not for me. My name's Eep. This, is my family, the Croods. If you weren't clued in already by the animal skins and sloping foreheads - we're cavemen. Most days we spend in our cave, in the dark. Night after night, day after day. Yep. Home sweet home. When we did go out, we struggled to find food in a harsh and hostile world. And I struggled to survive my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods are chased by beasts across the desert. They escape from creatures up trees. They hide behind rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were the last ones around. There used to be neighbors. The Gorts, smashed by a mammoth. The Horks, swallowed by a sand snake. The Erfs, mosquito bite. Throgs, common cold. And, the Croods. That's us. The Croods made it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug protects his family from a GIANT BEAR OWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of my Dad. He was strong... and he followed the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow falls across their feet and Grug ushers his family home. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the ones painted on the cave walls. Anything new is bad, curiosity is bad, going out at night is bad. Basically, anything fun is bad. Welcome to my world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all run back into the cave where Grug slams the rock door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY LIGHT ON CAVE PAINTINGS COMES UP AGAIN. But this time the light casts an ominous tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is a story about how all that changed in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because what we didn't know, was that our world was about to come to an end. And there were no rules on our cave walls to prepare us for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAVEMAN HANDS PRESS against the rock wall. They PUSH. A BLINDING LIGHT FLOODS the screen.

dialogues.speaker: SEQ. 100
dialogues.text: A HUGE CAVEMAN, GRUG, RUSHES forward, screaming, growling, and throwing handfuls of dirt in a THREAT DISPLAY. He BLINKS in the bright morning light. He LIFTS and HURLS a large boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaaaar grooooOOOOoooowwwll ERF ERF Glaaaaaabbbbllllllllthhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As suddenly as he began, Grug stops. Panting, he waits for the echoes of his outburst to fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug TURNS to the cave entrance, he prepares to BELLOW a signal, but before any sound escapes his lips--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAVE GIRL, EEP, bursts from the cave. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to wait for my signal Eep. Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep scares a pack of nearby Liyotes away. They pounce on Grug briefly before scampering off. Eep spreads out on an overhanging rock. She BASKS IN THE SUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been in that cave forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days is not forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is with this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep would you come down here? You're being so dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE GIRL, SANDY, charges out next. Her display is more terrier-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no Sandy, come back here. Remember the signal. Good girls wait for the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAVE WOMAN, UGGA, scrambles out next. She is mostly focused on catching Sandy, giving only cursory effort to her display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I get Sandy, I'll go back in, and you can give the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, you're already out now.

dialogues.speaker: THUNK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I am waiting for the signal, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the voice of Grug's nine-year-old son from inside the cave. THUNK is eager to please his dad and emulates his every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, Thunk. Just, come out. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not so fast) Uhh, but if you don't give the signal, how do I know you're my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signal isn't so you know it's me, it's so you know I wasn't eaten by an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is the signal an animal noise? I mean, doesn't that just confuse things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'm still waiting for the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigh. Hoo hooooo! Hoo hooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk comes out growling, and barrels into Grug. Thunk picks up a boulder and throws it. It ricochets off the cliff wall and careens into Grug. Grug gets plowed over by the boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sits up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're still fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast formation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods form up in a flying wedge, with Grug in the lead. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see some real caveman action out there. We do this fast. We do this loud, we do this as a family and never not be afraid. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMPRESSED TIME - The Croods RUN out of Crood canyon, across the wide expanses of desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEQ. 150 - SMASH & GRAB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and the Croods come to a stop at the HUNTING GROUNDS. They are spent from a fifteen-mile run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... breakfast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a nest with a huge unguarded blue egg. The Croods take shelter behind a rock. Grug PEERS over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep's hand SHOOTS up. Thunk is less than enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll flip for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug LIFTS Gran on his hand, and FLIPS her up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call her in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran FACE-PLANTS, her head buried in the sand. Only her tail is showing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tails. Thunk's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positions. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family fades back and splits up. They get into fighting/running position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Thunk. Go. Come on Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk BREAKS COVER. He dashes into the open, SNATCHES the egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! Way to go. Take it to the cave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk PASSES Grug and makes a bee-line for Crood Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gerf bird smashes Thunk and steals the egg back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep and Sandy MOVE IN on the bird. Sandy NIPS at its heels while UGGA CLIMBS up onto its head. She PULLS the egg from its beak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down range, TRIP GERBILS SURFACE. They STRETCH their shared tail across the Ramu's path like an arresting cable on a carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga RISES to THROW the egg to Grug - the gerbils WRAP their tail around the Ramu like a bola. The Ramu GOES DOWN hard. Ugga and the egg ROLL forward. The Trip Gerbils SNATCH up the egg and make off with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get um Mom! Do it for the Croods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran's cane HOOKS the gerbils in the middle of their tail and WHIPS them up and over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIBBLING the egg down-range with her cane like a hockey player. LIYOTES POP UP from behind hoodoos. They SWARM in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Liyotes TRIP Gran. They steal the egg, and HIT THE GAS. They are INCREDIBLY FAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old lady down! Eep, avenge me. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched in the shade of a scrubby bush, like a runner on the blocks - she has the Liyotes in her sights. Eep LAUNCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep runs after the Liyote with the egg, cutting him off in his tracks he slams into a cactus launching the egg into the air. Eep leaps into the air taking back the egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of Jackrobats see Eep and swarm around her. She loses her footing and throws the egg to Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug catches the egg and runs by the entrance of a small cave. Thunk following close behind accidentally trips over the tail of a sleeping Bear Owl knocking Grug to the ground and fumbling the egg once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk catches the egg just as the Girelephant bears down on him from behind and lifts him onto one of its tusks. The family members meet up as they begin their long run back to the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An entire swarm of animals chase the Croods as they head back to their cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear Owl is awakened and goes after everyone on the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug protecting his family from the BearOwl tosses each family member onto the Girelephant's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug dodges the BearOwl's attack and uses him as a launching pad to get himself safely on the Girelephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk is happy to see Dad is safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey Dad, can we eat now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait till we get home. Eep put on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance to Crood canyon appears on the horizon. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep hangs off the edge of one of its tusks as Grug takes over the other. Together they dig their heels into the ground, slowing down the Girelephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bearowl continues the chase. The Croods maneuver the Girelephant to fend off the Bearowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girelephant moving way too fast readies for the crash. The Girelephant crashes into the entrance of the canyon, sending the Croods flying in. They all tumble. Grug makes an extraordinary football catch. He holds tight to the meal as he slams into a rock. Grug holds up the egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright! Good one, dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Thunk. Drink up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug tosses the egg to Thunk, Thunk fumbles it and it cracks open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like fast food tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family passes the leaky egg around quickly, each Crood gets a taste. Thunk is the last Crood to get a mouthful, he hands it over to Grug-- the egg is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. I ate last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW TOUCHES Grug's feet. He looks up - the sun is setting behind the canyon wall. He HOLDS UP his hand to gauge how much daylight is left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two knuckle warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Croods. Go, go, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. Darkness brings death! We know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods RUN INSIDE THE CAVE. Ugga picks up a heavy stick off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon is full. Bath night. (grumbling, Gran tries to run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run for your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga pulls Gran back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to lose my protective layer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you've got ants. (hanging Sandy up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whack! Like she's cleaning a rug, Ugga SMACKS Sandy hard with the stick. Dust and bugs fly off of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Sandy doesn't fuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga CLAPS her hands together and Sandy knows to let go. She hits the floor and SCAMPERS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug enters and looks around the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she still out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she hates the cave, Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON EEP clinging to the side of the sheer rock face above Crood cave. She RAISES HER HAND to `catch' a few more moments of sun. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG getting his `bath.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she not like the cave? It's so cozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a little, dark, Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is finished with his bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep! Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep begins to climb down the wall outside when she hears a sound in the distance. Curious, she begins to climb even higher. Grug leaves the cave, searching for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I gotta close the cave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG exiting the cave... Grug sees that Eep is at the very top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep continues to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Grug, the Bear Owl appears up the canyon. It SPOTS Grug and the open cave and RACES to attack. Grug sees the BearOwl in full attack mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug throws a rock which momentarily stuns the creature, allowing Eep to JUMP DOWN and DART into the cave. Grug barely gets the cave closed in time. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear Owl PUSHES his paw through the narrow opening, and FEELS around for the Croods. The Croods are like mice in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was too close!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching. I was fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing up there, Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then why did you go up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you know? Stop looking for things. Fear keeps us alive Eep. Never not be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep climbs up on a ledge and curls up in the corner where a tiny spot of light seeps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm? What was that? 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little louder) I mean, why are we here? What are we doing this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one said survival was fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm? Would you come down here. Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Grug CLIMBS up. Ugga PULLS Grug back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug. Off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug climbs back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't see why she needs her own ledge. That's all. That's what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's working through some things and needs her own space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things? How long is this going to take? Really? I mean she already doesn't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pebble hits Grug in the head. It came from Eep's ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? She's listening. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she wants to survive, she has to follow our rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a story? Eep loves those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good idea ... How about a story, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, tell us a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods minus Eep gather in a semi-circle on the ground. Grug retrieves Sandy and her Krispy Bear from the bone-crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Can I borrow that? Thank you. Eep! Your old favorite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't played with that thing in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we'll hear the story of Krispy Bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sits and waits a beat for Eep to join, but she stays put. As Grug talks, he gestures at a rough sketch on the wall of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time ago, this little bear was alive. She was alive because she listened to her father and lived her life in routine and darkness and terror. So she was happy. But Krispy had one, terrible problem. She was filled with... curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga covers Sandy's ears. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And one day, while she was in a tree, the curious little bear wanted to climb to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no sooner than she climbed to the top, she saw something new and died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug SWATS the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Her last moments of terror still frozen on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug holds out Krispy Bear. The family is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, same ending as everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it, dad. I get it. I will never do anything new or different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man, Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan across the walls to reveal they are covered with stories all seemingly with the same ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, everyone sharpen your teeth and let's pile up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All their worst fears confirmed, the Croods snuggle into one big heap, warm and comfy. Grug casts a glance to Eep's ledge. She doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods sleep peacefully in their pile. Except Eep, who tosses restlessly on her LEDGE. Outside, we hear the ROARS and HOWLS of prehistoric creatures fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then cutting through the primordial night is a MUSICAL SOUND. Unsettling. Unearthly. Eep creeps around her sleeping family and cautiously approaches the "door" to peer outside, when suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! A bright light blazes through the gaps around the boulder door, bathing Eep in an OTHER-WORLDLY GLOW. She chases the flash of light around the cave trying to catch it in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep presses her face against the cold boulder, trying to get a look at what is outside, but she can't get more than a blurred glimpse of the canyon beyond - and the disappearing light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate to see more, Eep braces her back against the cave and PUSHES the plug rock with her legs. Slowly, she shifts the rock, careful not to wake her father. It takes all of her strength, but she manages to move it just enough for her to BARELY SQUEEZE out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep stands outside at night for the first time ever. Her heart races. The hot night wind blows against her face and through her hair. The forbidden sensation is exhilarating. The canyon beyond is quickly swallowing the light - it will be gone in another few seconds. With one of her hands pressed tightly to the cave `door', she steels herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep LETS GO and DASHES after the light, SCRAMBLING through the SANDSTONE NARROWS, bounding from side to side. As she disappears into the darkness of the canyon, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light ahead is growing brighter. Eep is closing on it. In her excitement, she missteps and SNAPS a stick underfoot. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was barely audible. Eep instinctively FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge SHADOW of a TUSKED CREATURE is cast on the wall above her. Eep throws a rock at the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She POWERS STRAIGHT UP the stone wall with unexpected speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature RUNS. Eep tops the wall and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep steps into a small clearing. Stuck in the ground, is a TORCH. As far as Eep knows, this is the thing she was following. Eep crouches down and cautiously approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE - Eep can feel the heat from the fire on the palms of her hands and her face. TENSE. EXCITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But camouflaged against the rock wall behind her, something MOVES. A WARTHOG CREATURE stands upright and creeps up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep reaches out to TOUCH the flame. The torch blows away from her. The wind has changed direction. The breeze at her back, Eep smells the Creature behind her. On her face, awe turns to determination as she wheels and grabs the creature. She THROWS and FLIPS it over her shoulder. It hits the torch, knocking it to the ground. Eep jumps back, GRABBING a good-sized rock - she's poised to bash the Creature's brains in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh! Nuh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature defensively raises its arms, hands in front of its face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands? Eep GASPS, shocked to see HUMAN HANDS attached to this monstrosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature slowly puts his hands to the sides of his grotesque head, and RAISES its mask. It's a boy... he's BEAUTIFUL! This is GUY. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep LEAPS BACK a few paces, DROPPING the rock on Guy's foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep moves swiftly to silence him. She POUNCES on him and TWISTS his head sideways. Guy is SUFFOCATING. He feels around for a stick and BASHES Eep in the side of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a person, like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep TOSSES the boulder aside and LIFTS Guy with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of... like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep OPENS Guy's mouth and pokes around inside. She SNIFFS at him. Turns him upside-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, could you not, hee hee hee, that tickles. Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep looks closely at BELT, a sloth wrapped around Guy's waist. Belt's eyes OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep DROPS Guy on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OW! Wow. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep jams her foot over Guy's mouth. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! I'm not supposed to be out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy BITES her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She KICKS Guy in the stomach. He ROLLS sideways. Guy is getting the worst of this encounter. Eep kicks Guy off- frame. We HEAR the fight continuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is awakened by wind coming from the cave opening. He pushes the "sleep pile" off of him. Checks Eep's ledge... but she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Grug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the cave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug stands outside the entrance to the cave. Peering into utter darkness. He steels himself... and then releases his hand from the "door."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy is still on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain, defeated) Wow. You're really strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame DWINDLES. Guy MOVES toward it. Eep BLOCKS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's mine. No, no. I caught it! 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way Guy is getting past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dying. I can fix it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I hate the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep sees a kindred spirit. She gets out of his way. Guy PICKS UP the torch and BLOWS. Eep scoots closer to Guy, staying in the circle of light around him. As Guy brings the fire back to life, the relief on his face is familiar to Eep. This boy seems to have power over light itself. Eep is smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does what you tell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the flame) Hi, fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said it was dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh sorry,--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes from where you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep BALLS her fist, GRABBING Guy tightly by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make some for me. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Okay, it doesn't come out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make. MAKE! MAKE IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep SQUEEZES Guy like a tube of toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do this a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something CRACKS. Eep DROPS Guy - he's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you dead? Can I have your fire if you're dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt RUBS two flat rocks together and places them on Guy's chest like defibrillator paddles. Guy BOLTS upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, those are cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think? Listening shells, activate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt AND Guy use shells to LISTEN to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I concur. Tiger girl, we need to leave immediately. He tries to pull her by the arm. She stays put like an anchor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained, rushed) Ow. I'm Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Belt. Cook, conversationalist, navigator, also keeps my pants up. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhiiyaa! Yaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are "pants up?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Let me clarify, Eep. The world is ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da da daaaaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Belt both do gestures to accompany the Da da daaaa. It seems very important to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it. It's coming this way. First, the Earth is going to shake. Then it breaks open. Everything falls in. Fire. Lava. I don't mean to sound too dramatic, but Aaaaaaaugh. Believe me, everything we're standing on, all this right here, will be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again with the gestures. It's a little weird to Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get to high ground. I know a mountain, that way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points into the distance. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our only chance. (extending his hand) Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Belt reach out their hands to Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy hands the shell to Eep. And Eep is mesmerized. Guy pulls his hog-mask back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here. If you survive, call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep test-blows the shell. It makes a sound, she giggles. When she looks up to thank Guy, he is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Hello? Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep BUMPS directly into Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? What took you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I left on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... youuuuuuu... ww-what!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, let me explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low GROWL interrupts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BEAR OWL Sniffing around. It passes over a log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN to reveal Grug hanging under the log by one hand, Eep dangling in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never let me talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and Eep move up the canyon. Eep furiously kicks a rock, it nearly hits Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are tense between the two. At the KEYHOLE, they are met by the rest of the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug! What happened!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I am so mad right now, that I can't talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never believe it. I found something new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New?!!!! The Croods all SNATCH up stones. They form a defensive circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New's a big problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep is trapped in the middle of the defensive formation. She SQUEEZES out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep. Stay inside the family kill circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't bad. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New is always bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He was nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? Excuse me? He?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, I thought he was a warthog, but then he turned into a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange. Usually it's the reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug RAISES an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep's got a boy hog! Eep's got a boy hog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep ELBOWS Thunk in the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a boy. Watch, okay. I'm gonna call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep pulls out the SHELL. She BLOWS into the shell - the sound ALARMS the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SMACK the shell from Eep's hand and SMASH it with their rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep is incredulous. The dust clears - the panting Croods are satisfied the object is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was beautiful. You want to see dangerous? Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pelts Thunk with a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww! My sniffer! 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Eep, that's it. We're going back to the cave and you're going to stay in there until you're older than... her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? You can't keep me inside forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep throws a tantrum of epic proportion. She SLAMS a rock on the ground. It SHATTERS to dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREAK! A strange GROAN is heard from under the ground. Then a small amount of sand falls from up above. A crack starts to splinter under their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said this would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BOOM! The ground starts to SHAKE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the cave! GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods RACE through the CANYON NARROWS, fighting their way through falling boulders and shifting ground, heading towards the safety of their cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods see the cave entrance. The canyon walls above their home start to crack. Grug sees that the falling rock will crush the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug leaps and tackles his family, protecting them from the mass of rocks crashing down. The top of the canyon collapses and the Crood's cave is destroyed. Everything is engulfed by dust. The earth settles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust clears a bit - the Croods are in a tight ball, covered by Grug. Grug stands, all Croods were sheltered and safe under his mighty arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Grug, the cave, it's gone. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks back to Crood cave. It is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug searches the rubble for any sign that the cave might still be there. He finds one handprint, split in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carefully fits them back together. Emotional, he lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eep steps forward, a shaft of light filtering through the dusty veil from the wreckage crosses her face--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dust descends, Eep sees A NEW WORLD beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to see this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dumbfounded Croods stare in awe at the beautiful world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods look out at the new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No one is going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug pulls Eep back from the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else did that boy say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Suddenly, bursting from the New World is a giant flying creature - a TURTLE DOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods reel back as it sails overhead. They turn to watch the Turtle Dove as it flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear a familiar menacing growl. It's the BEAR OWL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It roars and charges toward the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug instinctively GRABS a giant boulder and rolls it in front of his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear Owl runs and swats the massive boulder away like a ball of yarn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Croods are not behind it. They are running towards the New World. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods run towards the precipice with the Bear Owl closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the edge. The Bear Owl dives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods LEAP. They hang for a moment and begin tumbling down a steep jungle hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods tumble through a twisty mess of giant roots and strange plants and land in a heap. They all lie on their backs, disoriented, but momentarily calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sits up first. He turns to the high, high, cliff above them -- to the top, where they have lived all their lives up to this moment. A few loose pebbles continue to tumble down. There is no sign of the BEAR OWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others stand up, and they take in this new place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug takes a deep breath and then quickly counts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four, five -- BEAT. Grug smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran lands in a heap behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winces in pain) Oh... Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm not sure. Down. In a lower place. One thing's for sure, we can't go back the way we came. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods SIT UP. They are disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniff sniff sniff  Grrrrrrrrrrr.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed, urgent) Sandy? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy LUNGES at something almost disappearing into a bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug BARELY catches Sandy by her leg. Grug PULLS her back like a dog on a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! Come back, Sandy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy has a MOUSEPHANT in her mouth. Grug knocks it from Sandy's mouth. A gaggle of mousephants run out from the bush and scurry away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't be out in the open like this. We need a cave. Now step where I step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Stay quiet. Hopefully nothing big knows we're here yet. PULL BACK - a huge colorful predator, THE MACAWNIVORE senses something. He SITS UP and STALKS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CROODS moving fitfully through the strange forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Okay. Wait. Okay. Wait. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods cautiously move in fits and stops through the middle of this thick, pre-historic rainforest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Dad, just to be clear, are we looking for the exact same cave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was me, I'm just throwing this out there, if it was me choosing the cave, I would go with a smaller cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they trek, strange creatures (BEAR PEARS, PUNCH MONKEYS) watch these foreigners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front of the line, Grug is freaked out. But in the back Eep is taking in the wonders. They pass through a curtain of hefty hanging pears. After they pass the "pears" all turn to watch the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A leaf FLUTTERS down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep and Grug LOOK UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug launches into his Threat Display -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WWAAAAaaarrgghhaarrraaaarrgghhh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flails his arms around and jumps about in front of the nearest Punch Monkey. No reaction from the Punch Monkey. Grug stops, confused... The Punch Monkey now breaks into BROAD GRIN... Then hauls off and - THUD - Punches Grug in the face! Grug reels back, surprised - turns... Right int another Punch Monkey. It winds up and - THUD! - it hits Grug - Grug reels back - into another Monkey - THUD! -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright dad, go get `em! Oh, oh, now you got em-- Now they're really hitting you. Dad I got it, just stop running into their fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran joins in and punches Grug in the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah, I'm loving this. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug, when you're done, we should get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot: Grug is being bounced back and forth like a pinball from one punch Monkey to the next. The Punch Monkeys are whooping and hollering - this is great fun! The Punch Monkeys let go of Grug and begin running away for no apparent reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug staggers backwards into the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! You can't get past this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A colorful 'bush' rears up - it's not a bush, it's a MACAWNIVORE! The Croods react, terrified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug throws a rock at it. The Macawnivore catches the rock and SPRINGS! -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb! Climb! Climb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug pushes and forces the Croods up a huge tree then as it steps away-- it is actually a giant animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRUG'S POV: A cave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods jump off the bird leg in hopes of getting to the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Hurry up, let's go! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods all RUN LIKE CRAZY in the direction Grug pointed. They step inside the "cave." SLAM! The front of the cave comes down. The Croods have jumped inside the MOUTH of a LAND WHALE! 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look! This cave has a tongue. Awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Land Whale stands up and then SPITS the Croods out through its blow hole. The Croods land in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's one, two, three, four, five... six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And seven... if we're counting Chunky the Death Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrrrrrrr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore appears from behind some nearby grass. It looks at the Croods with delight. Suddenly, the shadow of the setting sky passes over the Macawnivore. It freaks out and retreats into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! It's scared of the dark... wait... we're scared of the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for good reason, because as the SHADOW from the setting sun falls across the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, thousands of PIRANHA OWLS BURST from the grasses around the Croods and form a huge undulating cloud above them. It's a beautiful sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cloud of Piranha Owls then SETTLE on a massive LAND WHALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later, they fly back into the air - the whale is SKELETONIZED. It CRUMPLES to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill circle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods form their defensive circle, brandishing rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep spies a SKULL lying in the sand. She SPRINTS for it. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep! Eeeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep breaks a horn from the skull and BLOWS on it loud and long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GUY hearing the horn. He is happy to hear the sound, knowing it's Eep calling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as Guy begins walking towards the sound, Guy notices the circling birds in the sky. Alarmed, he DASHES off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy appears at the treeline. He spots Eep standing alone in the clearing. He sees the birds heading towards her. He runs and leaps off a ROCK OUTCROPPING jumping right over the CROODS who are huddled near the ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy lands and in one fluid motion knocking the horn out of Eep's hand to stop the noise then STRIKES a spark with two STONES. The birds close in, blotting out the remaining light. All goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a tiny leaf of flame FLUTTERS to life before Guy. He THROWS two more handfuls of grass on it, and it FLARES UP! The light SPLITS the onrushing red tide of birds like a knife. For a few moments the Croods are inside a TORNADO of the tiny monsters. The mass PASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug SLAPS at one last smoldering bird FLUTTERING past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug TURNS to see Guy, HOLDING his daughter. Grug's expression DARKENS. He SNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-da.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sigh.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug pushes Eep aside and shows Guy his threat display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auughhauhhhgggh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Guy and Eep are circled by the Croods. They are in defensive ape-like positions. Each doing their threat display. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaarr, grOooOOOOowwllll,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLaaabbbllllellelller!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy stands in front of Eep defensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavemen! Stand back! They're practically animals. See their bony, sloping foreheads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge primitive teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The excessive body hair? Oh, that one's got a tail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy PULLS his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. I'm going to have to take their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping the knife away) No. It won't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep nods toward Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the sun is in his hands! 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods keep circling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. It's "fire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug grabs him and squeezes him tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make some for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't come out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make. Make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! Guy's ribs are cracked for the second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a lot like your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy falls in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, now he's broken.

dialogues.speaker: UGGA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, it's a baby sun. Grug turns to see Ugga, Thunk, Gran and Sandy are now sitting very close around the fire, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Stay back. We don't know what it wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grug moves around the circle, picking up sitting Croods and placing them a safe distance from the fire, he talks to them like a kindergarten teacher:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we'll all sit here, and wait for the sun to come back. And tomorrow we'll find a new cave, and pretend today never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the fire) Isn't this fun, Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks around to see that Eep is kneeling beside Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep, don't touch him. Goodness knows where he's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, behind Grug, Sandy ATTACKS the torch. She shakes it with her teeth, EMBERS FLY EVERYWHERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, Sandy's hurting fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug reaches down and scoops up Sandy. (NOTE: From this point, Grug will hold onto Sandy, no matter how much she struggles, kicks and bites.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy! No! Fire is not a play thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, what a cute little guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, stay back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods snatch at the embers as they dance in the air around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the embers has caught onto Thunk's tunic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It likes me! (after a beat) Hey! IT'S BITING ME!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk takes off running like a maniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame explodes into embers, which starts more fires in the grass around him. Grug looks at the growing fires with utter confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! You're not my friend. Stop, stop touching me! 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk! Uh, try hiding from it in the tall dry grass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk sprints through the grass, arms flailing, as a ring of fire blazes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading with fire) Stop please, please. I'm only nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran cackles at her grandson's misfortune, but then she realizes her WALKING STICK IS ON FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angrily, Gran starts to slam the burning end of the stick on the ground, trying to put it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she only ends up making more small fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, more fire babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Gran tries desperately to save her cane, Ugga starts throwing sticks on the small fires, which begin to grow in size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, your Dad, he's trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I won't let him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep and Guy witness the FIERY MAYHEM:

dialogues.speaker: GRUG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold on son, come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRUG is chasing THUNK in circles, throwing rocks at his flaming butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you anymore! 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy, who is still in Grug's arms, but facing backwards, is now holding onto a burning stick and lighting everything she passes on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeeee!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran, who is still trying to put out her stick, is batting it into every tree and bush she can hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga carries a REDWOOD above her head and then tosses it onto the small fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat up, babies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Ugga ignites a massive bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods appear like a bunch of violent, lunatic pyromaniacs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran is pounding her walking stick on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL - she is standing on the edge of a giant corn field that is slowly catching on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die! Die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOF! The fire on her cane has finally gone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I win!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. And then WA-POP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant ear of corn explodes blasting Gran off frame who slams into Thunk. The speeding ear picks up Ugga, Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not so scary once you get to know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep and Guy are HIT by the speeding corn. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. We're the Croooooods! And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeding ear CRASHES into a lone tree, sending Guy and the Croods sprawling across the tundra. The flying ears ROCKET SKYWARD and BURST like colorful fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Looks like magic. And smells like food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popcorn kernels RAIN DOWN upon the Croods. They are BURIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat it, it's new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods burst out of a mountain of popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still alive!

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, keep eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy BURROWS out the side of the popcorn pile like a prisoner escaping Alcatraz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gasping for air  (checks to see if he's been

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where's Guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy RUNS for the mountain. Eep POUNCES on Guy like a tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mountain? High ground? End of the world, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That already happened. It destroyed our cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo. That was just the beginning of the end. The end of the end is still coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to a dog) Eep. Drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep SETS him down. Guy BOLTS but discovers Eep hasn't let go of his hand. Guy is YANKED backwards like he's been tied to a piling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let him go! What if we don't find a cave before sunset? What if it takes a few days? What if the birds come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need his fire, dummy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Grug grabs Guy and throws him in a log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You're staying with us till we find a cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug hoists Guy in the log onto his shoulder. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug moves out, AWAY from the mountain. The family falls in behind Grug. Thunk is carrying a huge piece of popcorn that he's snacking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No I'm not. Don't make me part of this. Stay here if you want, but let me go. I've got a dream, a mission, a reason to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm... I've got an idea. Let's go to that mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TALL MOUNTAIN way in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad really has his heart set on a cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, there, are, caves on that mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mountain. Mountains are safe. Mountains have caves. And water. And sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Did you hear that? I can get my own stick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Sticks. Caves and sticks. Crazy sticks. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, a RUMBLE. This gets Grug's attention. Grug STOPS. The Croods wait to see what's going to happen next. A Mammoth FALLS out of sight, SWALLOWED by the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da da daaaaa. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy tries to attack Belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. That thing is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt antagonizes Sandy by sticking his tongue out at her. Sandy goes at Belt again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, it's okay Sandy. That's just a belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug takes a step back. Turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made a decision. We're going to, that mountain! Don't ask me why. It's just a hunch. It just feels right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Grug. We've never really walked that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think my feet can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never live long enough to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, just think. Our whole family, packed together on a long, slow trip across country? Days and nights with just each other. We'll tell stories. We'll laugh. (glancing at Eep) We'll become closer as a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep RAISES one eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods have not traveled far. The camera starts tight in on Thunk and Sandy. Sandy is harassing Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaugh. Get her off. Get off. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not ready to challenge her, then don't look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Sandy as she moves past Gran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you keep your big giant arms on your side of the trail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy moves past Ugga, Eep and Guy who is still stuck in the log and being carried by Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more touching. No more touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this fun? We're taking our first trip together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk accidentally bumps into Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop shoving, or I will pull out your tongue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to turn this family around? Do you?! Because I will turn this family around so fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera slowly pulls out from the family in chaos as they walk across the burned out landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods are traveling across the dry land. The camera has pulled out from the family as they travel. Family chaos continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you can hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go really bad. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk starts to HOP WITH HIS KNEES GLUED TO EACH OTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go behind one of those lumpy things and make it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Something bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have stopped for water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Liyote turns to watch the Croods as they travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, can I take a turn carrying him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even louder) NOW?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do this all day long. No, no, no, and still no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, more traveling. Now we are in the Turkeyfish hunting grounds. The camera is so far away the Croods are only a speck in the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug, exhausted, in the foreground with family chaos over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dying on an empty stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug, we're all pretty tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty dizzy, so I'm just going to lay down for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll eat when we get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taking too long! I'm grabbing a snack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran jumps up and tries to grab Belt. Belt pulls a bone knife and defends himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. No. Don't do that. He will cut you. That's not food, he's a pet. My pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a pet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An animal that you don't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call those children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man should have a pet. It's weird, and wrong. It's-- (spies giant bird) ...It's food!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no please! 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that. That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHOOPING sound comes from the grasses ahead. A giant TURKEY FISH raises its toothy head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food fixes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug grabs Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, show me your hunting face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep shows her hunting face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you! You're still grounded!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feet hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against a rock next to Gran, Sandy, Eep and Ugga. Guy notices Eep is agitated. She STARES in the direction the men went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry girl wants to be doing what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! I wasn't ready! 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk CRASHES THROUGH the bushes, PURSUED by the Turkey Fish. Grug is being DRUG behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on Thunk, I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off! You stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No seriously, what are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turkeyfish squashes Grug into the ground. Then continues chasing Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Turkey Fish) You've got a ton of eggs. Just make another egg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk FLIES INTO FRAME and SPLATS against the rock. The Turkey Fish climbs to the top of a nearby rock and dives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're just rubbing it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAPPED on a rock in front of the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bronto Scorpion suddenly STRUGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Who's hungry for scorpion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods PULL at the legs. They TWIST and SNAP OFF like lobster legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the egg and the bird? 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we lost him. But when the bird stepped on me and pushed me into the ground, the scorpion grabbed a hold of me and one thing led to another and here we are eating him. Win win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dismembered legs continue to STRUGGLE. Guy looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough. Not enough. I need more. I need more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran looks hungrily at Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look at that. She's not gonna eat me right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too skinny. If she was gonna eat anyone it would be--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww! She's locked her jaw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone get a stick! Get her off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy looks on, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you sick old monster! Hurry! Put the stick in her mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt gives Guy a "let's get out of here" look. Belt rolls Guy away from the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold her still. Use a rock. Ugga would you just hit her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy LEAVES. Eep chases him and pins him down. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you rolling away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww! I just want something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have bug for dinner. Plenty of bug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I'll let you help me hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! They're all over me... Tell my story...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy lays a snare in the low grass. He WALKS to the base of a rotund, spikey tree, unwinding more rope as he goes. He TIES the rope around the base of the tree. Then he hands the loose end to Eep. Belt stretches his arms WIDE. Guy STOPS jumping and points up to the top of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep takes the cue. She LEAPS up and grabs the leaning top of the tree. Her weight gently BENDS the tree top down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Guy carefully SETS the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you call this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy makes sound effects to get his point across as he describes the trap. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains with sounds) soft whistle Raargh, Thump thump thump, thubububububub soft whistle poom! Tadaaaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt opens his arms wide showing Guy has been alone a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy pulls out a weird miniature TURKEY FISH PUPPET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TURKEY FISH getting ready to eat the TRIP-GERBILS. The Turkey LIFTS the creature to his mouth to DEVOUR it, but he's INTERRUPTED by a WHISTLING sound. He TURNS to see the silly little puppet dancing about. The Turkey Fish DROPS his meal and cautiously APPROACHES the puppet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GUY AND EEP working the puppet. Eep is having the time of her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're good at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are so into what they are doing, they accidentally get TANGLED UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just move your arm... no, your other arm. Oh, that one's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their struggle to UNTANGLE themselves, Eep and Guy inadvertently insult the Turkey Fish. It CHARGES. Eep and Guy don't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turkey Fish MISSES the snare, LEAPS the rock and SNATCHES the fake bird off of Guy's head, THRASHING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... It didn't step in your trap-y, thing. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep BOLDLY STANDS in front of the bird. The Turkey Fish grabs Guy and tosses him high across the open field. He goes flying through the air, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG - hearing the commotion. Guy lands back in the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Eep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep is in full parkour as she runs from the Turkeyfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug STEPS FORWARD. He's going to SPRING the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She LEAPS the snare, PUSHING Grug DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Turkey Fish HITS the trigger. The snare TRIPS. The bird BITES at the cavemen, but comes up short. The Turkey Fish WHOOSHES BACKWARDS into the air. He FLIES a couple hundred feet up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and CRASHES down in a cloud of feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TURKEY ROASTING over an open fire. It looks golden and juicy. Grug is agitated. The Croods are devouring the Turkey Fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an avalanche of flavor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROODS are eating like wild animals. They practically MAUL each other for scraps. HOWLS and SNARLING fill the night air. Guy is amazed and shocked at how the Croods are wolfing it down. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy sits to the side, his ankle roped to a heavy rock. Guy and Belt share a concerned LOOK as they politely eat their meal. Eep comes over and sits next to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we won't be having any leftovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are "left-overs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when you have so much food to eat you have some, left over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never have that much food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is struck by Eep's words. Ugga sees Grug is hurt. Guy and Belt are struck by this as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug, how about a story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good idea. How about a story huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah a story, tell us a story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Croods gather around Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time there was a little tiger who lived in a cave with her family. There were a lot of rules, but the big, simple one was to never leave the cave at night. And the door was so heavy, you'd think it would be easy to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So easy to remember!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! But, while everyone was asleep, she went out anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! And no sooner than she did, her cave was destroyed and everyone had to go on this long, sucky walk, with some weirdo they met, and died! The end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! I did not see that coming. Twist ending. My stories never end like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Two stories in one night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods LEAVE Grug and GATHER around Guy. Guy is uncharacteristically dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But it won't be as good as Grug's. Um, once upon a time, there was a beautiful tiger. She lived in a cave with the rest of her family. Her father and mother told her, "You may go anywhere you want but never go near the cliff, for you could fall."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And die. Good story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking the story is over, the Croods begin to get up. As Guy begins talking again they settle back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when no one was looking, she would go near the cliff, for the closer she came to the edge, the more she could hear, the more she could see, the more she could feel. Finally, she stood at the very edge, and she saw a light. She leaned out to touch it, and slipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she fell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she flew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did she fly? 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A place with more suns in the sky than you can count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be so bright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
