dialogues.text: A place not like today, or yesterday, a place where things are better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow isn't a place, you can't see it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, yes it is. I've seen it. That's where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug studies Guy. Is he crazy? Eep though is entranced. Eep and Guy lock eyes. There is something growing between them. Grug and Belt see it too. Grug is not thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, WE are going to shut our eyes and sleep. And when we wake up we're going to find the place that has everything we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug stuffs Guy neatly back inside the log. Grug CURLS UP by the fire with the LOG TUCKED UNDER HIS ARM far away from Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: snoring, tossing and turning  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning light kisses Grug's cheeks. He's sound asleep. PULL OUT to reveal that Guy's log is now teetering over a cliff edge - there was another subduction during the night, and half of the Croods' sleeping platform has sunk two hundred feet. Grug is still grasping Guy's log, which now hangs over the fresh abyss, and the still- asleep Guy is now SLIPPING out of one end. In the nick of time, Grug SHIFTS position, inadvertently TURNS the log, and Guy starts slipping out the OTHER end. Guy WAKES UP, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods trudge behind Grug as he cautiously makes his way to the mountain. Grug SNIFFS, and TESTS the ground - he moves like a man in a mine field. Meaning SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep walks alongside Guy, who is still being carried by Grug in the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was too close. It almost caught us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching. We were fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to move faster. Do you people have any other speed aside from "wander?" I'll take a shamble at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you have a minute? How did the tiger fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only share when I'm outside the log. I'm funny that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave this to me. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep FALLS BACK behind Thunk, getting him between she and her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Thunk, you have a spider on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep SMASHES Thunk in the face, KNOCKING him into Grug, sending Guy and the log FLYING. Grug shoots Eep an annoyed look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sees Guy has ROLLED away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug goes to retrieve Guy, and STEPS on something sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaahhhhhh! Do not step on those weird, pointy rocks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean these rocks? Ahh owww! Do not step on these rocks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk steps on the coral - it CRUNCHES under his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside, girls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran steps out, and then SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Nobody's listening! No one is listening. You cannot walk on those!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy stands on the coral without flinching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arraughrragh come back here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there goes our chance for survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our log!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug must make the choice to go after Guy. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Arraugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug cringes and bellows with every step. Guy still locked inside the log, hops away as fast as he can. Grug leaps out and grabs the log only to loosen it as Guy jumps to a coral patch below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, ow, ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy now free runs and hides behind a giant shell. He looks back at the Croods as they try in vain to cross the field and feels pity for Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Jumping doesn't help, I mean, just briefly, but it doesn't get better! Ow! Do not walk on your hands, the hands do not help at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy looks back at the stranded Croods. Then he looks again to the tall mountain. Belt sees that Guy is having a hard time leaving the Croods. He needs to make a choice. Belt makes it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeccoomme on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt walks Guy back to the Croods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you, but we're going to have to make a few changes around here. The log ride is over. Drop the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug grudgingly DROPS the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, kick it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug BARELY NUDGES it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug KICKS it a quarter-mile. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, smart, Guy... now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is now wearing "shoes" -- some made of leaves, sponges and some are actually fish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga and Gran wobble on their new shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk is covering his eyes, too afraid to look down. Thunk looks down at his horrifying fish shoes. They blink at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Good fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep is covering her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Now you can look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep peers down at her new boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhh! I love them! Where are my feet!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep slips, and falls into Guy's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. You're really

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug walks over as the two fall to the ground. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait. Whoa. Whoa. WHOA!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! She's up. I'm good. We're good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These shoes are great! Where do you get these ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, Belt produces a piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy stands Thunk against a wall. Guy stands next to him. Belt OUTLINES them. Guy excitedly gestures to the silhouettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling it, a brain. I'm pretty sure it's where ideas come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. I don't have a brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotten along just fine without brains till now. Cavemen don't need brains. We have these. Heeya! Haha! (balls his mighty fists) That's what I'm talking about! Ideas are for weaklings. Grug punches at the air in front of Guy making him wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's get to that mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga and Eep notice each other's shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow. I love those!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good fish. Don't eat my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods run, slowly at first, then faster. And faster. The shoes make the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug encounters a bunch of Punch Monkeys again. He readies himself for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy hands out bananas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug throws his banana to the ground only to slip on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sees the Macawnivore down below in the crevasse waiting for his Croods dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sees Guy making something out of sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling by stilts over a crevasse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family hobbles across a canyon on their stilts. Guy helps Eep from falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... How'd the tiger fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumped on the sun and rode it to tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug doesn't like seeing his daughter so close to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no! The family moves across, Grug is the last to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug spies Chunky the Death Cat below him. Grug WHACKS Chunky in the face with a stilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chunky ponders the strange sticks Grug is perched on, then WHACKS a chunk out of them. Grug DROPS down by a yard or so. Panicking, Grug RACES across the chasm, losing stilt height with every SWIPE of Chunky's paw. Grug doesn't make it across - SNARLING and BITING sounds emanate from the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooowwwww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods stand at the top of a cliff. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug tries to maneuver his way down the cliff by clinging to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and the other Croods sit on a giant leaves, sledding down the side of the canyon past Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass Grug up as he continues to make his way down by tiptoeing. Grug stumbles and falls down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi dad! Bye dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A FLASH POPS against the Croods. SWING THE CAMERA AROUND to reveal A HUGE STORM hanging like a purple curtain before them. The Croods stop dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain line BEARS DOWN on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug tries to PUNCH the drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen rain before... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't get out much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy opens an Umbrella to cover himself from the rain. Belt pulls Eep under the umbrella to be close to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmmm. Belt makes an Origami boat. He and Sandy sail across the rain puddles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug seeing Guy and Eep snuggling under the umbrella, grabs the umbrella away from Guy. Grug gets hit by lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the Croods open their umbrellas to take cover as they enjoy the RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods stand on a tiny island in a shallow ocean - Eep is pointing at her own reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep, looks dangerous. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dad, you say that about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep goes to jump in the water. Guy STOPS her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy CANNONBALLS. Then SURFACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep tentatively HOPS in. Guy STEADIES her. Then shows her how to move her arms in a swimming motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy SUPPORTS Eep by holding one hand under her tummy. She begins to SWIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran and Ugga SMILE mischievously - a positive vibe is building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods ALL JUMP at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is left alone. Belt uses Grug's arm as a diving platform. Gran, Sandy and Belt are doing synchronized swimming. Then Grug sees Eep and Guy SURFACE - Eep is on Guy's shoulders! This is too much for Grug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh! No no no! Not cool. Not cool. Not cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug DIVES IN to put a stop to any potential shenanigans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug's huge tidal wave SWAMPS Guy and Eep. Grug SINKS to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG laying on the bottom. His family SWIMS above him on the tails of Fishcats, confident and free and buoyant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone bubble escapes Grug's nose, like oil oozing from a sunken wreck. He's feeling mighty extraneous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug sees the Macawnivore swimming towards him. Grug swims for his life. Ends in a big splash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the bear says, "Your cave?" I've been dumping my bones here since last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week, haha. That's a funny story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a story! It's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, just making something up... to make you laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah, I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods stand motionless before an open plain, deeply sculpted with meandering grooves which form a massive MAZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy is handing out SHELLS to the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, one for you, and this ones for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is annoyed by everyone blowing their shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. That's enough. I don't see why the kids need their own shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if anyone gets in trouble, we can call the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- you're saying we should split up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can try more paths at once. It's the fastest way through. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Croods stick together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your way isn't safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no no. It's my job to keep you safe. I'm still in charge and we are not splitting up. (seeing Eep and Guy together) Except for you two. And that's final.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug SITS down like a silverback gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, A HUGE RUMBLE. The EARTH STARTS TO SHAKE VIOLENTLY. The Croods and Guy are KNOCKED DOWN into the Maze each `falling' into a separate entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They disappear into the rift like a penny dropped down a drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grug and Guy slide passed each other. Frustrated Grug, tries to punch Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MAZE
dialogues.text: The SHAKING COMES TO A STOP. Everyone (now separated) gathers themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG-- finding himself alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is everyone alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to calm him) We're okay, Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? I'm freaking out a little bit. Just tell me what to do. Just what do I do right now? 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. I'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Too slow. Everybody, keep moving forward and we'll get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking very frightened.

dialogues.speaker: GRUG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Remember never not be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay. I'm gonna pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk PICKS UP his shell, and tentatively makes his way, alone, into his branch of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON EEP (OR GUY?)-- in another part of the maze. She puts her hand on the giant wall to her LEFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK and see that they are actually in parallel `channels' but with the huge wall between them. ON Gran and Ugga - encountering carnivorous flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Thunk - encountering a croco-pup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Eep - finding a flower dropped on her path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Grug - reaching a fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga and Gran don flowery camouflage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk THROWS his shell at the Crocopup, MISSES. To his surprise the Crocopup returns the shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk plays fetch with this portly beast, which shows him the way through the maze. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep PICKS UP the flower, puts it in her hair, then finds a more flowers dropped on her path. She playfully begins hunting for Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Belt are secretly and playfully tossing flowers in Eep's path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug POPS out of a passageway - he's back where he began. He chooses another tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga and Gran pass unharmed through the flower grove - the colors and smells are overpoweringly vibrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep surprises Guy and Belt in their hideaway as the two of them continue to throw flowers over the edge and onto Eep's path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy slips and falls onto a huge lilypad. He smiles up at Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a moment before Eep shyly vanishes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug finds himself back at the entrance of the maze. He grumbles and enters a different tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy appears at the exit and puts his hand up to the setting sun that kisses the top of the mountain. Guy is amazed that he and Eep are both doing the same thing. He is smitten. Guy goes over to Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep and Guy turn to each other, just as Thunk emerges and tosses a rock for the Croco-Pup to fetch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here boy, catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shell note signals Ugga, Gran and Sandy's arrival. There is an obvious change in the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga removes her hat to reveal her new look. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaah raaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud shell blast interrupts. It is followed by two others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug lets out another blow on his horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG still stuck in the maze. He holds his head in defeat, and TOSSES the shell down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCK-IN on Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP a giant redwood tree. The Croods are gathered in a cozy crook of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt mixes drinks while Gran relaxes in a hammock. Thunk is playing with his new pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy. Whose my good boy? You need a name, you want a name? I'm going to call you - Douglas. Look at him. Can you do tricks? Roll over. Come on Douglas, roll over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas ROLLS OVER, right OFF the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy Douglas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt POURS a drink for Gran. Sandy takes Gran her drink as she spins over to her on her starfish shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in love once. He was a hunter, I was a gatherer. It was quite a scandal. We fed each other berries. We danced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then my father smashed him with a rock and traded me to your Grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY/THUNK/EEP
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga and Grug approach. They hear the LAUGHING coming from high above. Grug peers up and sees the SWINGING HAMMOCKS, torch lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Croods! Come get down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug, they're okay. Guy's with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oh, `Guy'. `Guy' is with them. Well thank you for bringing me that interesting Guy update!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAT - Ugga regards her husband

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. I'm gonna go up and why don't you join us when you stop being a big drag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga climbs up the tree to be with the rest of the family. Grug isn't thrilled with Ugga's shot at him. He picks up two rocks and tries to make fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep pile? How about a story, huh? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug listens intently. All he hears is laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk, Sandy Belt and Gran are sitting around a torch, listening to one of Gran's stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Torg said "Know it? I drew it!" 68.

dialogues.speaker: THUNK GRAN SANDY BELT
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha ha ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga arrives and sits next to Guy. She takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it was hard for you to bring us along, but they had the best day of their lives... Thank you for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUMBLE distracts Guy. He looks to the horizon. FIRES and SMOKE on the horizon mark the leading edge of the collapse. Eep comes to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy LIGHTS A TORCH and leads the Croods up, up, to the forest canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy BLOWS OUT his torch. The night sky is revealed in all its glory. The Croods are amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music POUNDS as the spectacle SWEEPS around the Croods. Perched on the canopy of the forest the Croods seem to sit at the very brink of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More suns in the sky than you can count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every sun that crosses our sky, comes to rest up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG ARRIVING at the tree top. When he sees the stars he DUCKS back down, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He overhears the rest of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep with tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with Guy. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is beside himself with panic, sick at the thought of losing Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go without Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes one of us. Count me in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really Mom? Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug continues to listen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug has no idea how to protect us. In fact, he has no ideas at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not true. What about that one time when he a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face it! If he actually had an idea of his own I'd, I'd have a heart attack and die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family is searching for Grug. He has disappeared. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a big guy. How can he just disappear like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey wait. Let's ask that ugly lady if she's seen dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug SPINS AROUND. He's wearing a rasta-style wig made from knotted grass. The sight SHOCKS Ugga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GRUG with the family standing around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Playing to Eep) Yeah, Wow. Like, I was up all night cuz like all these, ideas just kept coming to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug LIFTS his tunic, a Boa Constrictor is wrapped around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt! New and improved! It's even self- tightening. Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The constrictor SQUEEZES Grug till he turns blue. Grug SMACKS it and it relaxes a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that on your head? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug strokes his weird, fake rasta-hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swings his long hair around) I call it a "rug." Rhymes with Grug. And this one. I call it a "ride." Rhymes with Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug regards a boulder as if it's a Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, doesn't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna get us places faster than shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug climbs on top of the rock, facing the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Try to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LEANS FORWARD. The "car" ROLLS downhill and SMASHES through a redwood, TOPPLING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face SLATHERED with reddish mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painting is a thing of the past. I call this, a "snap-shot."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug takes a huge flat stone and SMASHES it against Thunk, forcibly transferring the mud image to the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug shows the Croods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it again. I think I blinked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk PASSES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing wooden sunglasses. They are effectively wearing blindfolds. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call them "shades."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun doesn't hurt my eyes anymore! Where do you get these great ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I don't have a brain, they're coming from my stomach. Down deep below, and then up again into my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk walks into a tree. All the other Croods RAISE their "shades" in time to see Grug walk over a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug. We have to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I got ideas, I got thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Grug lifting a huge flat rock over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this. I call it a "mobile home." Isn't that something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge BEAST BUNNY JUMPS into the opening of the rock. Grug is smashed flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on one side of a primitive Teeter-Totter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm calling this one a "lifterator."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug tosses a massive boulder on the opposite end. Grug is LAUNCHED into the sky. Grug becomes a speck in the sky. He is HIT by LIGHTNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost feel sorry for him. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug falls back down onto the teeter totter dislodging the boulder from the other side. The boulder rolls back down onto Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah, no I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy is rowing a SHELL BOAT with everyone inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to do Grug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burned and battered, laying in the bottom of a turtle shell boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga is attending to his injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if I could have ideas like Guy, maybe Eep would listen to me. Maybe she wouldn't want to go with Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga gets a PAINED look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Grug, is that what this is all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga is about to confess her thoughts of going to Tomorrow with Guy when Grug interrupts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I also thought it would kill your mother. So you know? Win win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view of the mountain is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of birds fly overhead darkening the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shell boat hits the shore. The Croods step out onto land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion goes off on a nearby mountain. A PLUME of magma BURSTS from the water in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks around for shelter and spots a cave. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cave! Everyone inside. Come on! Hurry up, let's go. Go, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods don't want to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more caves, Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna jump on the sun and ride it to Tomorrow with Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, so you're all going to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from the Croods answers his question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk joins the others. It's the last straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to stop worrying for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job to worry. It's my job to follow the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rules don't work out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kept us alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't living, that was just, not dying. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga, everyone, you have to listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga doesn't move. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would be dead if we listened you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to follow Guy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug slowly turns around to face Guy. He is smoldering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy, run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug lunges toward Guy, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug ATTACKS Guy - they fall down an embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug CHASES Guy across a TREMBLING landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pointless. We're running out of time. Everything is collapsing. You're being irrational and counterproductive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big words anger me. Keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countermeasures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt THROWS fruit at Grug. The fruit HITS Grug square in the face. He's blinded. He doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember how you were this morning? You changed, remember? Idea man? Modern man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy comes to a sudden stop - he's stepped in a small puddle of TAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug wipes his eyes clean of fruit. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... am... a... CAVEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Grug do a slow-motion PLUNGE over a tar-fall. As they descend Grug SWINGS at Guy, coating himself with tar. Grug's arms are held like glue. His punches stop well short of Guy's face. Guy and Grug arrive in a wide pool of tar. They SINK slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hnnnnnngh! No. What is this stuff that saves you from my punches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tone of Guy's voice SINKS IN. Grug CEASES his attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Grug. You have to stop struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have to get back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one gets out of this. Believe me. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks at Guy again - he needs more than that. Guy takes a deep breath - this is going to be hard. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was little when it happened. The last thing my parents told me was, "Don't hide. Live. Follow the Sun. You'll make it to Tomorrow."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This resonates with Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thread of light trickles through the storm, falling just near enough to Guy he can gather it in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You followed the light. My daughter is a lot like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's like you. She loves you but always forgets to say it. Just like you forget to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug ponders this. A CHANGE comes over Grug. He focuses on Guy. This hits Grug hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I was just busy keeping them all alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy considers Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. That's what Dads do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug smiles. He regards Guy in a different light. He sees him not as a boy but a man. Someone good enough for his little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... but we can't do that from here. We need one of your ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buoyed by Grug's encouragement, Guy swings into action mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt! Emergency Idea Generator, activate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt hits Guy in the head with a rock. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEQ. 2250 - GRUG & GUY ESCAPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are tracking with the MACAWNIVORE. Suddenly, the big cat stops. His eyebrows raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACAWNIVORE'S POV - a FEMALE MACAWNIVORE PUPPET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. But he's doing the best with what he has. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and Guy are holding bones connected to the puppet. Belt SIGNALS to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. Belt, I want romance, drama, sincerity. Move me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt makes music, which grabs the Macawnivore's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay he sees us! Belt plays a little melodramatic tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug halfheartedly moves the bones he's holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our cue. Now work it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The puppet starts shaking its tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming over. I don't think our puppet looks scared enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared? I'll show you scared. Hand me those acting sticks! 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug shakes the puppet and makes a frightening sound of terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Macawnivore leaps forward and jumps on the puppet. He grabs it and pulls it up out of the tar, bringing Grug and Guy along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and Guy hang on to the bones of the puppet frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore shakes the puppet, pulling it out of the tar along with Grug and Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The puppet breaks apart, the Macawnivcore turns to Grug and Guy. He is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da da daaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore dashes towards the pair. They try to run from him. The Macawnivore's paws slip slowly backwards into the nearby tar--he's stuck. The tar snaps him back and throws him far from Grug and Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt blows a whistle signalling a field goal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug PATS Guy on the back. Grug realizes his hand is stuck to Guy's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods come running to help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and Guy TURN to see the rest of the Croods. Grug waves to the family with Guy stuck to his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we're okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family stops to take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're okay. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground shakes violently. Meteors stream across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug. Your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug knows his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us to Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSHING up the gun-sight into the bright rays of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! Come on. We're gonna make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Croods rush toward "Tomorrow," it is a golden, ethereal image created by a perfect alignment of sun, clouds, and mountain. From the Croods POV it looks as if they can cross a solid bridge of clouds and climb onto a waiting sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. The sun. We can do it! We can ride it to Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Grug is taken with the sight - it's there after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods stare at the open meadow across from them. Tremors violently SHAKE the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the rift OPENS in front of them, the hot gasses and blasts of hot ash BURST the clouds from beneath. The debris shades the sun, revealing a very Earthly landscape beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Croods perspective, Tomorrow vanished before their eyes. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOCKWAVE knocks a large chunk of rock off the edge the Croods are standing on blowing them backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. The sun was right here. It was right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! A gargantuan jet of ash STABS at the sky. Ugga PULLS the Croods away from the ledge. She herds them back toward the gunsight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go back to the cave. Hurry, hurry, stay together. Let's keep moving. Move, move! Everybody hold my hand. Thunk let's go. Go! Let's stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Grug doesn't join them. Instead, Grug takes a step TOWARD the precipice, peering into the curtain of ash as if trying to burn a hole straight through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug? What's wrong with you? Grug we'll die if we stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug spies a wispy shaft of light STRUGGLING through the ash cloud. He HOLDS UP his hand to feel it. A beam of light settles on his palm. Grug is ENLIGHTENED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly to Grug) Grug. Listen to me. We've gotta get back to that cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug looks back at his family - huddled, terrified. The picture of what he would have wanted in the beginning. The sight bothers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug TURNS to face them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more dark. No more hiding. No more caves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To follow the light. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile breaks across Eep's face - her dad has answered the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't change. I don't have ideas. But I have my strength. And right now that's all you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We don't know what's over there. Maybe nothing. It's too risky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt wipes a tear off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug LIFTS Guy above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've wanted to throw you away ever since I met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh. That's a joke, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug's comment freaks Guy out. ANOTHER ANGLE shows Grug with a twinkle in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt puts on his helmet for safety. With a titanic effort, he HURLS Guy in to the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croods wait an eternity. Then - a HORN SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made it... He made it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Thunk. Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not coming, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you make it, so will I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug HURLS Thunk. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga KISSES Grug. She whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug wipes a tear from Ugga's eye. Then lifts her above his head. He HURLS her across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran is next in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mush, just throw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug LIFTS her above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You surprised me today. Lunkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug SMILES and throws her next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (landing on the other side) Still alive!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another TREMBLER. MORE cliff FALLS away. Now the distance is even greater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep is next in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have too much to say to you. I need to fix everything and I don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug embraces Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This works good. What do you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of calling it a Hug. (clears his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it rhymes with Grug. But you can change it if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like a "Hug."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep takes in the full effect of her dad's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground begins to shake and break apart around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gap grows wider. Grug lifts Eep and makes the greatest throw of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tumult parts briefly. Grug can see his entire family safe on the other side. He waves a last goodbye. To his surprise, a shaft of sunlight has settled on his open hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. I see him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family waves to Grug to let him know they are okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug is startled by another earthquake. The ground is ripping itself apart as meteors begin to fall around him. Grug dodges falling debris and lighting and manages to crawl into a nearby cave-- a familiar place for him. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug grabs two pieces of flint and starts clicking them together, just as Guy did earlier. They ignite. Grug has created his very first fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another earthquake shakes the cavern. Grug moves over to a wall and uses some nearby mud to paint a portrait of his family. He paints each member individually and then looks longingly at the family he will never see again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torch begins to go out. Grug blows on it and is startled by the massive Macawnivore beast, growling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Back! Stay back! Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore blows out the torch. Another meteor hits the cave with a loud boom! The Macawnivore stops growling and starts blowing on the torch along with Grug. It is just as frightened as Grug. Grug reaches out and pets the now gentle carnivorous beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug and the Macawnivore huddle together in a prehistoric armistice. When suddenly, Grug hears the dim tone of Eep's "shell signal." He rushes to the entrance to the cave. He surveys the raging CATACLYSM outside the cave as the world is being torn asunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the SHELL ALARM blow TWO MORE TIMES. His family is in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in trouble. Hang on! I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scale of his problem sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get across? Gotta think. What would Guy do? What would Guy do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something occurs to Grug. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He absent-mindedly hands the torch to the Macawnivore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug CLOSES HIS EYES, and CONCENTRATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ember of a thought FLICKERS TO LIFE in Grug's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... have... an... IDEA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug uses a log to wipe tar all over a giant rib cage. Grug runs out of the cave and into a nearby field and startles a pack of nesting PIRANHA OWLS. He turns back to the Macawnivore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meat-eating birds begin to chase Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Grug leaps onto the Macawnivore's back as the birds move in closer. The ground begins to break up violently as lakes empty themselves and entire forests turn sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore rushes into a giant rib cage that Grug has coated with tar. The Piranha Owls hit the rib cage and stick to it. As they fight to free themselves, the rib cage lifts off the ground. Grug takes a giant tree branch, ignites it, and uses it as a rudder, scaring the Piranha Owls and prompting them to fly in one coherent direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cage flies, above the fiery landscape, Grug sees Douglas, sitting forlornly with the shell still in his mouth. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug doesn't even debate it, he runs back for the little monstrosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug JUMPS out of the cage and rushes over to grab the gerbils. Then Grug notices a familiar Liyote hiding under a nearby rock. He GRABS the Liyote. Grug sees the TRIP-GERBILS stranded as well. Grug TWIRLS the Trip- Gerbils around his neck like a scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROAR BUILDS behind Grug - the pyroclastic flow is SPEEDING closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug CATCHES UP to the lumbering blimp-cage. He PUSHES it to go faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pyroclastic cloud BLASTS up the narrow passage. Finally, with Grug's strength, the cage CLEARS the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLOUD HITS them all, SWALLOWING the Cage like a speck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the edge of the cliff alone, BLOWING her shell horn. Behind her, Sandy HOWLS. Gran puts a comforting arm around her grandchildren, even she has a tear in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground begins to shake softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not safe here. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gran walks up to Eep. Eep continues to blow her shell horn. Eep and Gran share a moment. Eep breaks into tears. Gran looks at her shell horn and BLOWS it loudly. Eep is happily surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family, even Guy, steps up next to Eep and begins BLOWING their shell horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear from Eep's expression she has no intention of budging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga appeals to Eep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep, if your Dad were here, he would tell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you sound just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugga looks up. Guy LOOKS UP. Everyone looks up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's riding the Sun... but not very well. Everybody out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug CRASHES near the family. They run to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug! 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Where's the danger? Who blew their shell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all Grug sees is his astonished family staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eep RUNS to him, HUGS him ferociously, nearly knocking him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the Croods begin running to Grug. Grug hugs each of them like never before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four, five, six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug puts his arm around Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt wants to be acknowledged as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerrghh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the animals join in hugging Grug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And eight, and nine. Douglas runs up and licks Thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas! Dad you saved him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a boys gotta have a pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the group rises up as the Macawnivore stands near them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out, I'm a cat person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug notices a TAIL sticking out of Chunky's mouth. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh! No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chunky SPITS OUT the TRIP-GERBILS. He GRINS sheepishly. The TRIP-GERBILS run to Gran knocking her over in their excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family takes this amazing view in then looks to Grug for his decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSHING TOWARD A SHORELINE covered in dense palms, gentle waves lapping at the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Eep, fixing her hair. We PULL OUT to see the whole family preparing for a family photo.

dialogues.speaker: EEP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is me. My name's Eep. And this, is my family. The Croods. If you weren't clued in by the sun tans and pets, we're not exactly cavemen anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grug has a wonderful picture making contraption they are about to experience. The slab of rock smacks them all in the face leaving the first family photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do that again. I think I blinked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO THE SHORELINE, RUSHING ever closer to the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our world is still plenty harsh and hostile. But now we know the Croods will make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BELT riding on the back of the Crocopup, delivering a drink to Gran, PULL OUT to reveal she is in a sled, hitched to a team of Liyotes. The liyotes are tending to her. Gran sips her drink. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we changed the rules. The ones that kept us in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Ugga sharpening a spear. The Macawnivore comes in to frame with Grug riding on top. Ugga tosses him the spear. Eep, flips from out of the trees. She blows her horn to call Guy and the BearOwl for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because of my dad, who taught us that anyone can change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Macawnivore LEAPS through the trees onto a broad, beautiful beach with Grug and Ugga atop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunk breaks through the trees riding a LANDWHALE. Sandy and Belt are riding the Crocopup. Eep and Guy are riding the BearOwl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So from now on we'll stay out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first camera picks them up as it reaches the beach. It FOLLOWS the Croods as they TURN and ride toward a sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we can follow the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belt and Sandy poke their heads up at the base of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da da daaaaaaaaaaa.
